intro: Gaertnera humblotii, commonly known as the Humboldt's gaertnera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It has opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Gaertnera humblotii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
